p: The methylated dihydropyrone 189 and compound 274 were tested for in vitro antifungal activity using the Oxford diffusion assay against M. violaceum ( Microbotryum violaceum) and S. cerevisiae ( Saccharomyces cerevisiae), 189 and 274 exhibited moderate antifungal activity, inhibiting the growth of S. cerevisiae and M. violaceum at 25 μg/mL. Nystatin was the positive control for antifungal assays, previous studies had shown the MIC values of nystatin in the S. cerevisiae culture used was 4 µg/mL and for M. violaceum was 2 µg/mL [ 58].
